title: Rosemary McAuliffe
text: Rosemary Ann McAuliffe (née Belmont; born August 1, 1940) is a <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28United%20States%29">Democratic</a> politician, elected as the <a href="Washington%20%28U.S.%20state%29">Washington</a> <a href="Washington%20State%20Legislature">State Senator</a> for the <a href="Washington%27s%201st%20Legislative%20District">1st District</a> in 1992, beginning her term in 1993. Preceding her election to the State Senate, McAuliffe served 14 years on the <a href="Northshore%20School%20District">Northshore School District</a> <a href="Board%20of%20Education">Board of Education</a> and as Chair of the <a href="Bothell%2C%20Washington">Bothell</a> Downtown Management Association, leading to the area's revitalization. This district includes Bothell, <a href="Mountlake%20Terrace%2C%20Washington">Mountlake Terrace</a>, <a href="Brier%2C%20Washington">Brier</a>, <a href="Maltby%2C%20Washington">Maltby</a> and parts of <a href="Lynnwood%2C%20Washington">Lynnwood</a>, <a href="Edmonds%2C%20Washington">Edmonds</a>, and unincorporated <a href="Snohomish%20County">Snohomish County</a>. She served on the Washington State Senate's Early Learning & K-12 Education Committee as a ranking member, as well as on the Higher Learning Committee and Joint Select Committee on Education Accountability.
